data.similar: Encapsulates a lot of existing web modules like LWP::UserAgent
data.PS: The following links are only valid for module list maintainers:
data.rationale:
WWW::Browser is a web browser object that you can use directly in
    your Perl program. WWW::Browser makes it simple to programmatically
    surf the web, including "click" links, fill out forms, go back
    button, send and receive cookies, etc. WWW::Browser was specifically
    developed to implement regression testing of web-based applications.

    WWW::Browser uses the major web Perl modules like LWP::UserAgent
    and HTTP::Cookies and wraps them up into a single intuitive object.
